title: a dream I had last night
self_text: I was walking down the street and a man came up to me and said “you’re going to die” then he turned around and walked away, I don’t know why but it felt really real so I started crying and ran home when I got home I went into my room and laid on my bed thinking about what just happened and then suddenly a girl appeared out of nowhere and asked me if I was okay, she said “don’t cry” and gave me a hug, I hugged her back and we both cried for like an hour and then she disappeared so I layed there crying until my mom came in and told me that dinner was ready, I didn’t want to eat but I ate anyway, after eating I went to my room and played video games until I fell asleep

title: AITA for calling my mom a racist?
self_text: My mom is a bit of a racist and it's always been something I've tried to ignore, but she said some really awful things about my boyfriend the other day that made me lose it.  I'm not usually confrontational with her and I try to avoid arguments as much as possible because she can get pretty nasty. But this time I couldn't hold back and told her exactly what I thought of her opinions on his ethnicity. She got so mad at me that she threatened to cut me out of her life if I didn't apologize. So I apologized. Now she wants me to apologize again. I feel like she's being overly sensitive and manipulative, but I also know she's capable of hurting me deeply. Should I apologize again or stand my ground? I was thinking I should have just stayed quiet and let it go. I know I shouldn't be arguing with her about such things, especially since she's clearly so prejudiced, but I felt like I had to speak up. I still don't agree with anything she said, and I don't want her to think I'm apologizing to accept her views. I know my boyfriend would understand if he heard about this, but I don't want to involve him in our family drama.  AITA?

title: AITA for telling my friend she's a bad person?
self_text: My friend (17F) has been really mean to me lately, and I think it's because I don't agree with her views on certain topics. She recently told me that I should die if I ever go back to her house.  I didn't know what to do so I asked my mom, who said I should tell her that she's a terrible person. I did.  She started crying and got super mad at me. Then she called my parents and said they were ruining her life. I feel like I was the one being rude, but I also feel like she deserves it because of how she treats people.  Is this why I'm an asshole?

title: When will we ever get the vaccine?
self_text: Is there any point in us continuing to live like this? I'm so tired of being afraid and feeling isolated. It feels like our world is slowly coming to an end.  I know people have been vaccinated for other viruses, and it didn't take as long. Why are we having such a difficult time with this?

title: Why is the sound of a toilet flushing always loud?
self_text: I'm just wondering if there is something to it, or if everyone just thinks that it sounds louder than it actually does.

title: Why do some foods have a weird taste after eating them?
self_text: I had a burger today and it tasted really weird for like an hour, but my friend ate the same thing and said it was fine. Was that normal or did I just have a bad experience?

title: AITA for calling my mom out?
self_text: My mom has been telling me that I'm being stupid and childish when I have a good idea, or express my opinion on things she thinks are stupid. She often calls me names and belittles me.  I recently had an idea about how we could make our family dinners more interesting (i.e. less boring) by making themed nights, like Taco Tuesday or Pizza Friday.  My mom was super annoyed with me saying that and told me to stop bothering her with stupid ideas. Then I called her out and told her I thought it was dumb. She then said I was being childish and should go away.  I went upstairs and started crying because I felt really bad for hurting her feelings, but I also knew that I wasn't wrong and shouldn't feel so bad.  When I came downstairs again, she was gone, but there was a note on the table. It said "you will never be as good as your dad" in all caps.  Now I'm feeling worse than before because I don't know what to do.  AITA?

title: Cutting up a chicken breast?
self_text: Can I just cut the chicken breast into bite sized pieces without having to cook it first?

title: When a girl says she's "not into guys" but then dates a guy the next day, what's going on?
self_text: I have seen this happen more than once and it always makes me think something is not right. It could be that they are just being polite to their friends or family and don't want them to be upset by her dating a guy. However, there is no excuse for lying about how you feel when you know how someone else feels. So if she said she wasn't interested in a guy at all, why would she start dating him?

title: What's the best way to deal with a really rude guy at work?
self_text: He’s always looking for something to complain about, and when he does, it’s always directed at me. I’ve tried ignoring him, but he just keeps coming up with new things to say.  I know that no matter what I do, he will never change his attitude. I was wondering if there were any strategies or tactics that would allow me to deal with him in a calm manner.

title: The 2019-20 NBA season and the COVID-19 pandemic
self_text: I'm trying to understand how it all went down with the 2019-20 NBA season and the COVID-19 pandemic.  I know there was a pause, but how did it end? Did they finish out the season? Was the season scrapped altogether? What were the rules for playoff seeding?  Thank you for your help!

title: AITA for telling my cousin to leave my house?
self_text: So I’ve been having a rough time recently. My dad passed away about 2 months ago and the grief is hitting me hard. Also, my mom has been sick in bed with the flu for about two weeks now.  I live at home with my parents, my older brother (17), and my younger cousin (13).  My cousin is really clingy and always wants to be around me. She knows that things are tough for me right now but she still follows me everywhere and doesn't give me any space when I'm trying to relax or get stuff done. Yesterday she was following me into the bathroom, so I told her to go play outside or do something else and not follow me around. Then she started crying and yelling at me saying that I was being mean and didn't care about her feelings. My brother came in and said that I shouldn’t have yelled at her and it was wrong of me to tell her to leave my room. He then went up to her and started comforting her and telling her that I wasn't being mean and that she needed to respect my boundaries.  I feel like they’re both overreacting and being too sensitive. It’s not my fault that my dad died and my mom is sick, and I don't need someone clinging to me all day.  AITA?

title: Is there a way to avoid the constant notification spam from Reddit?
self_text: I have so many subreddits that I follow, and it's incredibly annoying when a new post is made in any of them because the app keeps notifying me. I know I can turn off notifications for individual subs, but it’s such an inconvenience to do it every time. So, is there any kind of setting or workaround that would allow me to just have the app not notify me at all?

title: AITA for saying a racist joke?
self_text: So, I was at the mall with my friends on Saturday. We were just walking around and shopping when we went to the food court. We got our food and then we sat down to eat. My friend Sarah started telling a story about her boyfriend. She was talking about how she had gone out to dinner with him and he ordered some type of shrimp or something.  I don't remember exactly what she said, but she ended up making a joke that was pretty racist, which made me cringe. It wasn't anything too bad, like a full-blown slur or anything. It was just a lighthearted comment about someone who looked like an asian person.   Then, a black girl came over and asked us if we were making fun of her. We weren't, so she told us to stop. The people around us were also starting to get upset, so I apologized to her.  It didn't seem like anyone was mad at me, so I assumed it was fine. But now I'm feeling really guilty about it, because I know that jokes like that are wrong. What do I do?

title: The thing that goes into the hole?
self_text: I'm not sure how to phrase this, but it's been bugging me for a while.  When I have to use the toilet (especially after eating something greasy), there's always a little bit of...stuff...that comes out with my poop.  I know it's just part of the digestive process, and it's gross, but I've wondered what exactly is coming out along with the stool itself. Is it bile? Or some other digestive byproduct?  Or is it just...waste?  I'm not trying to be disgusting or anything, just curious.

title: Who is the guy in the videos?
self_text: Does anyone know who he is and what's his name? He seems to be playing an electric guitar and he looks like he’s on a stage where it’s packed with people watching him play. I think he was performing during the events of the war, or something like that.

title: The sound of a knife on plastic?
self_text: I used to have a plastic knife that was used for cutting cake, and the sound it made when it cut through the plastic felt really satisfying. Now I'm trying to remember what the actual sound was like but I can't. Is there any way to describe it or is it just an unconscious memory?

title: AITA for not helping a struggling friend?
self_text: So, I have a friend (let's call her Sarah) who is going through a really tough time right now. She's been diagnosed with depression and anxiety, and it's pretty bad. She has been seeing a therapist and taking medication, but she says that nothing seems to be working, so her family and friends are trying to help her.  She said that she wants me to go to the gym with her and we can work out together. I was happy to do that because I know how much exercise helps with mental health, and I've had my own struggles with mental health in the past too. I always told myself that if I could get her to love herself, then maybe she'll get better. But I don't think I'm good enough for her or anything like that, and I feel like she needs more than just me. We've tried talking about things before, but she doesn't seem open to it. Also, she mentioned that she wants to go out to eat. My mom keeps telling me that I should take care of myself first, and also she thinks that I shouldn't be spending all my time helping someone else when I need to focus on my own life. It feels like I'm being selfish for wanting to spend time with Sarah, especially since she's going through such a difficult time. However, I want to make sure she knows that there are people who care about her and that she's not alone. It would mean everything to her, even if it doesn't change anything. I just want to let her know that I'm here for her. I don't think I'm doing anything wrong though. Am I the asshole for not going out to do those activities with her?

title: why is the video of the guy on the beach with a giant crab so popular?
self_text: I don't know what it is, but that video of the guy on the beach with a huge crab has been all over my tiktok feed for the past couple days and it's driving me insane.  I saw it once yesterday and now every single thing I see is that video. It's like the algorithm thinks I want to see nothing but a guy holding a giant crab. Is there anything else in the world?!

title: How can a company make money from selling things people are getting for free?
self_text: If something is "free" in the sense that it's given away, how does a company profit off of it? For example, an airline gives away a bottle of water to passengers, but they sell a soft drink for $2 or more. Or a hotel offers free breakfast, but charges $100+ per night.  I'm not asking about products and services that have additional value (like charging extra for upgrades). I am wondering how a business can be profitable when someone is receiving something of high value from them without paying anything.

title: Why does the phrase "Don't read too much into it" usually come when you've just found out something that seems like a significant and maybe even bad thing?
self_text: I am wondering what the reason is for the common use of the phrase, "don't read too much into it", after someone discovers a bit of bad news. For example, if my friend tells me they got a low grade on a test, I might assume their performance has declined or that they didn't study as well as they should have. However, most people will tell me not to "read too much into it". Is there any particular reason why people would say that when we find out about bad news?

title: Why do some people get sad when they see a baby?
self_text: I always feel a bit sad and empathetic when I see a baby, but it’s not an overwhelming sadness, just a slight feeling of melancholy.  I know many people experience that same feeling (and I've heard from others about the “motherhood instinct” or something like that), but also many people don’t have any reaction at all, and even seem annoyed by babies (which is understandable, I guess). Is there anything particularly special about seeing a baby that triggers that feeling in some people?

title: Is there a way to prevent the sound from my computer speakers playing when I have music playing on my phone?
self_text: The problem is that when I turn on the volume on my phone, it also turns up the volume of my computer speakers and it's annoying. There must be some kind of setting on either my phone or my computer to prevent this from happening. Please help me find out how to do this!

title: When I try to turn on my computer it just says "No Operating System Found"
self_text: No idea what to do next, so you guys can help?  I've already reinstalled Windows and I don't have another OS that would work.  Also my CPU is an Intel Core i5-8400 and I am running windows 10 pro 64 bit.  When I boot up the screen goes black for a few seconds then shows the BIOS which is fine but when it tries to load up the operating system nothing happens. It just says "no operating system found". Any suggestions?

title: AITA for cutting my sister’s off the Christmas card list?
self_text: My family has a tradition of sending out Christmas cards, and my mom sends them to all her friends and relatives.  I used to be on that list too, but I moved away and now live in a different state. She asked me to send my cards from this year so she could put it together as a group (like we did before). I have been sending my Christmas cards since I was 18-20 years old, and they were always really nice and decorated with a lot of love and care, but this year I just sent a plain white card with a simple message inside because I have a lot going on right now.  My sister went up to my house last week to ask why I wasn't on the Christmas card list anymore. I told her that I didn't think I deserved to be on the list after she had been acting like a mean girl to me at school. She replied by saying that she was never mean to me and that I was being ridiculous. I called her back to tell her that if she wanted to be part of our family, she should start treating me better.  She then sent my mom a text message saying that she was really upset and she wanted me to come over and apologize. I said no. Now I feel bad about telling my sister I don't deserve to be on the list anymore, especially when my mom is trying to make everyone feel included. But I also want to make sure she knows how much she has hurt me and how important it is for her to treat me better.   AITA?

title: AITA for saying something to my mom?
self_text: My mom is very strict and a bit of a narcissist so I don't always know if she's being genuine or not. She's been really working on her relationship with me lately but the whole time I feel like there's some underlying reason that I can't understand. Today I was at her house after school and we were watching TV, when she said "I'm glad you're here". It felt a little weird because it sounded like she was saying it out of guilt. So I asked her why she was saying that and she just laughed. Then I tried to ask again but she told me to drop it. That's when I got frustrated and told her she could have said anything else instead of making me feel guilty.  I know I shouldn't have said that but I was just feeling so frustrated and emotional about everything. She then went into an argument with me about how I need to be more appreciative and that I should be grateful to have her in my life.   Now I'm thinking about whether I was wrong to say what I said.  AITA?

title: AITA for not wanting to help my sister with her relationship?
self_text: My sister is a lovely girl, and I love her dearly. She has been dating her boyfriend, Ben, for about 6 months now. They're both really nice people but they've been fighting a lot lately. They get into arguments over the smallest things, and usually it's me that gets caught in the middle when they start bickering. It's like a constant cycle of them arguing, then me trying to smooth things over by making sure they're okay, then them getting back together and starting all over again. At first, I was worried, but it seems like they are just having issues because they're new to being together. But recently, they have been talking about moving in together, which makes me super anxious.  They’re both so different in their personalities and interests, so I can only imagine how much trouble they will have living together. My sister is always complaining about Ben, saying he does stupid stuff or doesn’t understand her. He tries his best to be understanding, but she is super harsh on him. I don’t think they are compatible at all. And honestly, sometimes I wish they would break up. Not because I hate them, but because I know they'll never be happy together. When I see them bicker, it makes me feel uncomfortable. It's like I'm trapped in an endless loop of sadness. The other day, my sister came to me crying after another fight with Ben. She said she couldn’t handle it anymore and wanted to break up with him. I told her that she should go for it, as she seemed miserable. Then she asked if I could talk to Ben about how upset she was, and tell him he needs to stop acting the way he does. She begged me to do it, saying she didn't have the strength to do it herself. At first, I refused, but she was so distraught and desperate that I eventually gave in. When I went to Ben’s house, I was super nervous and awkward. He was sitting on the couch playing video games while she was sobbing in the kitchen. I tried to act normal and told him that my sister was really upset, and she needed space. He was very calm and just shrugged off what she had done. After that, I felt bad, but I also knew that I did the right thing.  I thought it was the most appropriate thing to do. As they were constantly fighting and nothing ever changed, I figured maybe letting them separate would make them happier. But now, I’m starting to question myself. Am I being a terrible sister/friend? Or am I just protecting myself from more drama?

title: AITA for telling my sister she's being a dumbass?
self_text: My sister is 15 and I'm 18. We've been through some stuff together, but lately she's just been ruining everything with her stupid opinions that are all based on the internet or other people's opinions. She always tries to get me involved in these arguments and it makes me so angry! It's like she knows it will make me mad, but she does it anyway. Today, she tried to start an argument about what's considered "good" art, which is ridiculous because there is no good or bad art, just preference. Then she said something that was so obviously wrong and stupid that I couldn't hold back anymore and told her she's being a dumbass. Now she's pissed at me and won't talk to me.  AITA?

title: AITA for telling my friend to stop trying to flirt with my boyfriend?
self_text: My boyfriend and I have been dating for about a year now, we both love each other, and are pretty happy. We've known each other since middle school. She was the first girl I ever had an crush on (I was like 8), so she is kind of a big deal in our group. Lately she has been trying to flirt with my boyfriend all the time. She keeps leaving him messages saying things like "Hey babe" or "How's it going?" He says that he doesn't want her to do that because he likes me more than her. My friend gets really upset every time he tells her that. She started crying and making a huge scene at our party last night, but I didn't say anything about her doing it. It got really awkward when he told her he wasn't interested, but she still kept flirting with him. He then asked me if I wanted to go to the bathroom, which I did. When I came back, he told me that he wants us to be friends, but she's not gonna accept that. The thing is, he doesn't know how to tell her that, and I don't think he'll be able to. So I just thought that if I gave him a little push to tell her, maybe it would help. But he took the advice and told her straight up that he thinks she's disgusting and that she should leave him alone, and she left. Do I need to apologize to my boyfriend?

title: AITA for telling my mom that she needs to stop calling me and asking about my grades?
self_text: My mom is constantly texting or calling me to ask how I'm doing in school, what my grades are, etc.  I know she just wants to make sure I am succeeding and that I don't need help but honestly it makes me feel so stressed out because all I want to do is relax after a long day of school.   Yesterday, when she texted me about my grades, I told her to leave me alone because I will tell her if there's something wrong. She replied with the most condescending text ever saying "You should be grateful that you have parents who care about your education".  It made me so angry that I told her to stop calling me and leaving me alone.  My dad thought I was being rude and said I shouldn't say such things to my mom, but I think I was justified given how much stress she puts on me.  I am not an asshole for telling my mom to stop bothering me.

title: Why are there so many people who seem to be constantly fighting and arguing?
self_text: I've noticed that most of the people I know have had some kind of argument or fight recently, whether with a friend, family member, or even a stranger. It makes me wonder why people tend to always be in a state of conflict. Is it because we live in a hostile environment where everyone is just looking out for themselves? Or do people just get easily offended and start fights over the smallest things?

title: AITA for not giving a friend her concert tickets?
self_text: So my best friend (let’s call her Sarah) and I have been friends since kindergarten and we’ve always been super close. We had so much fun together growing up, and she was the first person who made me laugh until I cried. She always knows how to make me feel better when I'm down. Lately though, things have been really rocky between us.  She has been going through a tough time with her parents fighting all the time and she just recently got dumped by her boyfriend.  I know she needs someone to lean on right now, but she's been really difficult lately. She's constantly canceling plans at the last minute or making excuses to avoid spending time with me. She’s been really distant and moody.  Last week, she told me about an upcoming concert of a band she loves and asked if I wanted to go with her. I said yes immediately because I love that band too! We planned it out for weeks. Then, two days before the concert, she texted me saying she couldn’t go anymore because she had to help her mom with something. I was disappointed but I understood. It wasn’t like she did this often. When I didn’t hear from her the next day, I assumed she might have changed her mind, so I messaged her asking why she hadn't replied. She then texted me saying she’d actually canceled the tickets and given them away to another girl. I was beyond shocked and hurt, especially after planning this trip together for so long. She said she needed to focus on herself and her family, which is fair, but it feels like she's trying to push me away. I felt betrayed and ignored. I don’t know what to do. AITA?

title: Is the "best" way to do something always the most efficient?
self_text: I've been thinking about how much time and effort we spend trying to find the absolute best way of doing things, whether it is in a profession or just daily life. We're taught from an early age that there are ways of doing things that lead to better results, efficiency, and productivity than others. But are those methods really always the most efficient? Or does our obsession with finding the best method sometimes lead us to overcomplicate simple tasks, waste energy on unnecessary steps, and take longer to accomplish what could have been done with a simpler approach?  It seems like many people think the best way is the only way, but perhaps there are multiple effective routes to a destination. If so, why do we focus so much on achieving perfection when it may be more beneficial to simply find a route that gets us where we need to go?

title: AITA for telling my sister she looks like a trash panda?
self_text: My sister is a total weirdo and always makes me feel bad about myself, so I told her she looked like a trash panda today. She got mad at me for saying that and said I was being rude and didn't know how to be nice.  I don't think I was rude, because it's the truth, but I can see why she would get mad. It's not something you say to someone, especially if they're family, but I just couldn't help myself! Also, I'm going through a tough time right now with my parents and I need to take some time to myself. I was thinking of letting her know about my situation, but then I thought about what she might say or do, and I knew it wouldn't be good. Is it fair for me to tell my sister that she looks like a trash panda?

title: Can't find a specific song
self_text: I was listening to some music earlier and found a great song but now I can't find it anywhere online. The song is called "Let me be" by an artist called (I think) Kynar? or something similar.  The lyrics are really beautiful, the song starts with a male voice singing about his wife dying and then he sings in his own voice that he wants to be left alone. Is there any chance someone knows what the song is?

title: AITA for telling my mom to stop eating the food I cook?
self_text: My mom has been making me dinner every night for 10 years. It's a tradition and she loves doing it, but she always makes something that she likes. She is a vegetarian who only eats lettuce, tomatoes, cucumber, and cheese. We have a lot of other options in the fridge, like chicken, beef, pork, rice, beans, pasta, potatoes, broccoli, cauliflower etc. But she never tries them because they aren't lettuce, tomato, cucumber or cheese.  She doesn't even eat vegetables like broccoli or cauliflower. The last time she tried cooking, she made plain lettuce with cheese and tomato. I told her I was going to order pizza if she didn't make anything else. She got really mad at me. I think she was embarrassed and felt bad about not being able to make something else. I also feel bad about telling her to stop, as I know it is important to her.  I feel like I should try to find a way to tell her how I feel without upsetting her so much. Or maybe I am just overreacting and being an asshole.

title: is it normal to think of things as a collection of parts?
self_text: like, I'm watching a movie and i start to think of the characters as just individual pieces that come together to make the whole thing.  I don't know why or how, but it happens. does anyone else do this?

title: how can i cut out the sound of my phone ringing through my house?
self_text: I've tried turning off my phone, but it still rings and its audio comes through my speakers. I don't want to hear my parents ringtone or other people ringtones coming through when my phone is on silent. How can i block these sounds from coming through my speakers?

title: Why do they call it “eating” when you are not really eating?
self_text: I’m always seeing people say ‘I’m going to eat’, but if they're only putting a small amount of food in their mouths, how can that be considered “eating”? It feels like an exaggeration or some kind of metaphor, but I don’t know why.

title: AITA for selling my dad's old guitar?
self_text: My dad passed away last year, and he was a huge guitar player. He had this old Martin acoustic that he loved so much, but it was super worn out from years of use. I asked him if I could keep it after he died (I was the only child), and he said sure, as long as I took care of it. So I did, and kept it in a case and played it sometimes. But then recently, I realized I don't really play it anymore, and it's just taking up space. It's worth around $200, and I was thinking about selling it to someone who would actually play it. My mom thinks I should have just thrown it away, because she says my dad would hate me if he saw it. She also said it might be disrespectful. What do you guys think? Am I an asshole for considering selling it?

title: AITA for leaving my friend at the beach?
self_text: I’ve been friends with my best friend, Sarah, since middle school and we’re both in highschool now (we are sophomores). We love spending time together and always do but it’s usually just hanging out, going to the movies, etc.. But last weekend, Sarah invited me to go to the beach with her. She said she had a bunch of other people going and I was kind of hesitant because my family has a lot of plans that weekend but I agreed and we went! It was super fun though, and I didn't wanna leave early even though it was getting late. When we got back, she told me that some of the girls who were going thought that she was being so rude when she left because she was “rude” and “didn’t care about anyone else”. I was super hurt because I would never intentionally be rude or leave someone behind without telling them. So I called her up later to ask why she said what she did and she apologized and explained how she had been too harsh on everyone and she felt bad about it. The next day, she texted me asking if I wanted to go out again, but I was kinda tired from everything that happened and I told her I couldn’t. Now she keeps texting me saying that all of the girls are mad at me and they don’t want to hang out anymore. And she’s making me feel guilty about not wanting to go out with them again. I can’t believe she is accusing me of leaving them behind and she says that I’m being mean to them, which is totally false. She knows that I would never leave them behind like that and she should know that I would have never left them if they weren’t talking trash about her. I think I am the asshole here.  I'm a pretty good friend, right?  AITA?

title: why does the word "asshole" sound like it means something bad?
self_text: I've never heard a person use that word as an insult, and I'm not sure why I've never heard it used as a compliment either. It seems like the word is a neutral one, but people only use it to mean something bad.

title: Is it okay to wear a button up shirt with no top underneath?
self_text: I got a brand new white button up, and I wanted to wear it without a top underneath.  I thought that would be cool but my mom told me not to.

title: I hate when people put the word "assassin" in quotes, or use other quotation marks
self_text: I've been seeing a lot of people using quotation marks to denote that they are talking about an actual assassin and not some sort of fictional character.  It is annoying as hell.  Can we please just say it like a normal person?

title: Can you have a tattoo of something that's not a picture?
self_text: Yes, but it has to be a symbol, letter or word etc. like an abstract pattern or part of the alphabet.  It can't be a full picture of something because it will look stupid when you're older.

title: How can I turn my old iPhone 6s into a usable device?
self_text: I know it’s old but I still have the charger and it turns on, it shows my passcode and I can unlock it. However I can’t open any apps or browse the internet, so is there anything I can do to get the phone back to normal?

title: AITA for telling my brother to stop making noise while I'm trying to focus?
self_text: My brother has been playing his video games and going through all his stuff on his phone, making a lot of noise.  I told him to be quieter because he was bothering me but then he just started laughing at me.  Now I feel bad about it.

title: AITA for not helping a friend?
self_text: My friend (20M) and I (19F) have been best friends since we were kids, we've known each other our whole lives. He has been struggling with depression lately because his parents died in an accident when he was young. We always talk about it, but recently he's just been quiet, withdrawn, and constantly sad. When he asked me to come over on Thursday night, I said yes, thinking we could talk about what's been going on and maybe do something fun together. He told me that he had been feeling really bad lately and didn't want to leave the house, so I came over, brought snacks and drinks, and we watched some movies.  He started crying at some point and told me how much he hates himself and wished he was dead. I tried to comfort him as best as I could, but I don't know if I did anything wrong or right. He then called his mom and told her that he wanted to go out and hang with his old friends. His mom replied with "I don't care about you". Then she hung up. After that, he looked up my contact information and texted me saying that he had been seeing his ex girlfriend and they are planning to get married soon.  I said that I hope he is happy and that he deserves nothing but the best, and he replied by calling me back and telling me to stop being nice to him and that I should leave him alone. That's when I realized that I wasn't doing enough to help him and I was just making things worse.  When I went home, I took a look at my social media and saw that my ex boyfriend had posted a picture of himself getting married with his new wife.   The next day, my friend texted me saying that he was leaving town and never coming back.  I feel like I should have done more to help my friend and now he's left me behind.  AITA?

title: AITA for making a sarcastic comment?
self_text: I was at school today and my friend, let's call him Alex, said something that made me go off on him. He said "You're so quiet" in response to me saying something. Like, he knew I'd say something back to him, but when I did, he didn't acknowledge it or anything.  I replied with, "Yeah well you can't talk because you're just as quiet". It wasn't meant to be mean or anything, it was just a joke about how we both weren't talking much. But then I saw his face turn red and he got really mad at me, and told everyone that I was being rude and that they should ignore me. Then the teachers came over and asked us to sit down, which I did. The whole situation just felt really awkward and now I feel like an asshole.  I mean I know it probably isn't the biggest deal, but it was kinda embarrassing. So I don't know if I should apologize or not. Should I apologize or am I the asshole here?

title: AITA for telling my brother not to touch my stuff?
self_text: I’m a nonbinary person, and I live with my brother. We share most of our stuff, but I have a small drawer in the bedroom where I keep some things that are exclusively mine (e.g., makeup, hair products, etc.). My brother has been repeatedly taking items from it without asking or even knowing what they were. The first time he did it, I told him not to do it again. He didn't listen and took more items, so I yelled at him to stop. He got upset and started yelling back, saying that I was being controlling, and that he could take whatever he wanted because we lived together. He then took more items from my drawer. Now I feel like an asshole for yelling at him, but he kept taking my things! What should I do?

title: a friend of mine is gay
self_text: I know he's gay and that doesn't change anything, but like...I don't really know how to talk about it?  I want to be supportive and friendly, but I also don't wanna come off as weird or awkward or make him uncomfortable. I was thinking maybe I could ask him if he wanted to do something together, like go see a movie, but idk what else to say. Also, I noticed he has an issue with his voice and I'm wondering how he can live a normal life without being able to speak. It might seem like I'm asking stupid questions here but these are the things that keep running through my mind so please help me. Is there some kind of rule book on how to approach someone who is gay?

title: a slut is in my class and she keeps giggling at me
self_text: I hate her so much, but she just does not understand that I'm trying to focus on my work.  I have asked her many times to stop it, and she continues anyway. I think of killing her if she doesn't stop. She has no sense of respect or boundaries, and she's always laughing at everyone. This isn't a joke; I am genuinely upset with her behavior.

title: Can't remember how to use a microphone
self_text: I had a really rough time with my mic in high school, and it's been over 10 years since then. I've used headphones a bunch of times and got comfortable with them, but if I were to try using a mic again for some reason, I don't think I could do it at all. If I tried to speak into the mic, it would come out super distorted and quiet like nothing was there, so I would just stop trying altogether.

title: I think i'm losing my mind
self_text: My wife and I are at the store when we see a young boy about 6 or 7 years old walk up to us and stare at me for what feels like an eternity before turning around and walking away.  She asked him why he was staring at me so long and he said "I just wanted to say you look like my dad". I didn't know what to say, but I told him it was nice of him. Then he walked away. It was weird because I don't even know that kid.

title: AITA for telling my mom she looks like a walking corpse?
self_text: My mom has been struggling with depression and eating disorders since I was a kid. She’s always had a really hard time with her weight, and it’s gotten progressively worse in recent years. Recently I saw her at the grocery store looking pale and greyish (she has a very fair complexion to begin with) and I couldn't help but tell her that she looked like a walking corpse. I know this isn’t helpful or supportive, and I feel terrible about it now. It came out of nowhere as I was saying something else entirely, but I can't take it back. She got angry and started crying. I apologized profusely, but I don’t think it helped. She said I have no idea what I’m talking about.  I feel awful about it and I want to apologize again. Is this AITA?

title: AITA for telling my husband to stop yelling?
self_text: My husband has been yelling at me every time I do something wrong, like leaving the toilet seat up or making a mess in the kitchen. He always yells really loud and it makes me feel so small. I told him that his yelling is hurting me and he keeps saying that I'm being too sensitive. I hate it when he yells at me and want him to stop but don't know how.

title: Why does the song "The Sound of Silence" have such a quiet and muted tone?
self_text: I've heard it so many times, but there's always been something that feels off about the song. The lyrics are pretty depressing as is (if you consider a song to be depressing), but the music just doesn't match it. It feels like they didn't really try at all when recording the music. Is it because of how the song was recorded? Or am I simply being overly critical?

title: Why is the text on a single sheet of paper so small?
self_text: I'm holding it up to the light, and it still doesn't seem like there's enough space to put all that text. It feels weird, and it looks bad. What am I missing?

title: What are the benefits of cutting down trees?
self_text: What are the benefits of cutting down trees? Are there any? I mean, they're vital for the environment and we need them to breathe, but is it worth destroying forests so that we can build houses or farms or roads?  Or do we just need to find a way to live without them?

title: AITA for calling my friend out?
self_text: So I have a friend, let’s call her Sarah. We’ve known each other since kindergarten and are pretty close. Lately she's been posting on Instagram about how much she loves going to the gym but then also posts pics of herself in sweatpants eating pizza. It’s weird. She's trying so hard to be healthy. At first I thought it was cute but now I’m starting to think she doesn't actually care about being healthy and just wants attention. Like I don’t get why she would pretend to be healthy when she eats pizza all the time.  Today she posted a pic of herself with her boyfriend holding a large pizza box. In the comments I said “I don’t know how you do it” because she's always trying to lose weight and is always at the gym. She replied saying “thanks for your support”. That made me even more angry. It’s like she doesn’t realize how ridiculous she looks. So I called her out again saying “you’re not really trying to lose weight, are you?” She didn’t reply. Is that fair?

title: a new user on Reddit
self_text: I just got an invite to join a sub called “a new user on Reddit”. I am confused and concerned about why someone would be inviting me to a sub that is only for people who are new here, but I do not understand the purpose of it. Please explain or remove the invite from my inbox.  I’m also concerned because the invite came from the sub itself.

title: Is it possible to train my lower abs?
self_text: I've been trying to get rid of my belly fat for months but nothing seems to be working and I just keep getting a thick layer of fat on my lower abs. They are really developed with muscle, but they're still covered in fat so they look kinda ugly. How can I reduce the amount of fat on them while keeping the muscle growth?

title: Why does the movie "The Lion King" have a bunch of characters in it that are not lions?
self_text: Well, I'm watching the film with my little sister and she asked me why Scar is a tiger and why there are elephants, giraffes, zebras, etc. in the film. I told her that they were just used as background scenery to make it look like Africa. But then she went on to say that it's weird that the animals aren't all lions. And so I had to explain to her why there weren't all lions in the movie. So here's what I said: The Lion King is an animated movie, which means it has to be made up. It's set in the African savanna, but it isn't really based on real life. They could have put any animal they wanted into the movie. The whole point of the movie is to tell a story about a young lion prince who is forced to leave his kingdom by his uncle. His uncle wants to take over the throne because he believes he deserves it more than his brother. After leaving his kingdom, he goes off to live in exile and forgets all about his family and responsibilities. When he eventually comes back, he learns that his father died and that his uncle took over the throne and drove him out. He then returns to his kingdom to fight for his rightful place.  However, this film is mostly about the journey of the young lion prince who grows from a weakling to a powerful king.  It's important to note that many Disney films are heavily inspired by myths and legends, especially those from Europe. The Lion King is no different. It takes some elements from the story of Hamlet, Shakespeare's play about a Danish prince who seeks revenge against his uncle after his father dies. In Hamlet, the protagonist's uncle is a Norwegian prince who murders his brother and marries his wife. However, in The Lion King, the protagonist's uncle is a talking lion who kills his brother and marries his wife.  The reason why there are other animals in the film besides lions is because the filmmakers wanted to create a vibrant and diverse environment. They also wanted to include animals that would appeal to children. Finally, the film was made for entertainment purposes only. There's no need for it to be realistic. The goal of the movie is to entertain people. If they wanted to fill the movie with nothing but lions, then they wouldn't have to use other animals to add color and depth to the world.

title: AITA for going to the gym and accidentally spilling a protein shake all over my friend?
self_text: I'm a pretty average guy, 23 years old, works as an accountant. I went to the gym today (which is new to me) and I spilled a whole bunch of protein shake all over my friend in the locker room. She was there getting dressed and I bumped into her. The shake got everywhere on her clothes and she didn't like it. I said sorry but she wasn't happy about it. I offered to pay for the dry cleaning but she refused. I was upset that she wasn't accepting my apology so I started yelling at her which I now regret. It was kind of stupid of me to yell but I just wanted her to accept my apology. Now she won't talk to me.  I think I might be the asshole here.

title: AITA for telling my parents I'm not going to the wedding?
self_text: My family is planning a wedding next month and I was supposed to be in attendance but something came up that will prevent me from attending. My parents are very upset, as they don't understand why I won't attend. They want to know what the issue is and how they can fix it. It's just that I have a different event planned and I don't think they would appreciate me changing my plans to accommodate their wedding. How do I respond to them?

title: AITA for not letting my friend use my shower?
self_text: My friend (17F) was at my house and asked to use my shower. She said she was going out to the gym, but I noticed she left her gym bag in the car, so I thought it was a bad sign. When she came back, she had red eyes, and her face was swollen. Turns out she went to a bar and drank too much. After that, she said she'd be staying over and we were going to have some time together. I was really happy about it, but when I walked into the bathroom, there was a huge mess on the floor with vomit, broken glass, and blood. I realized she got hurt while drinking. I told her to leave my house immediately because I didn't want her around me or my family. I am not a nice person.

title: Why is the website "The Daily Storm" blocked by my school?
self_text: I was trying to read their latest article, and they blocked it on my school's network. They claimed that it contained hate speech, but all I saw were articles about how white people are losing control of western society (because immigrants are taking over). It just seemed like an opinion piece, not a call for violence or something.  I'm wondering if there is any truth to what they say about this site, because I would love to see if they are correct in their claims.

title: Why is the website for "The Daily Mail" so weird?
self_text: It's like a maze to get to anything! They have ads all over the place and it just seems like they don't care about making their site user friendly.

title: Is there a difference in how people speak to each other when they're drunk and sober?
self_text: I’ve heard some people say that people sound different when they’re drunk, like the way they talk is more slurred or something.  I can imagine it would be true if you were listening to someone who was just coming down from being drunk, but the same person might not sound any different than when they are sober.  Does the level of sobriety change the way people speak?

title: AITA for making my boyfriend do a weird thing at his friend's party?
self_text: My boyfriend (21F) and I (20F) went to a house party last night where we were invited by his friends. We didn't know many people there but they seemed like nice guys, so we thought it would be a good time. The vibe was pretty chill, nothing too crazy or wild.  We had been dancing together for a while, and the music turned up so we went into a separate room with some other couples. It wasn't a big deal until about an hour later when we were walking out of the room and my boyfriend said he wanted me to start screaming "This is how we do it!" while doing a silly dance. He kept saying that it was important for him to let everyone in the room know he was a man who could make women scream.  I don't know why he did this, but it made me uncomfortable. When we got back to the main area of the house, I started to feel really bad because I couldn't shake off the feeling that something was wrong. I didn't want to be rude, so I asked him if he was okay. He then proceeded to tell me that he was fine and that I should stop being so sensitive, and told me that he just wanted to have a good time and make people laugh. He continued to do this throughout the rest of the night, which made me even more uncomfortable. Later on, he said he felt bad for what he did and apologized. He then suggested we go get pizza.  I told my best friend what happened and she said that my boyfriend was being immature and disrespectful. She also said that I shouldn't have done anything he asked me to do. I didn't think so, as it seemed like he was just trying to have fun and show off, but I can see now that it might not have been the right thing to do. So, AITA for letting my boyfriend do that thing at his friend's party?

title: How to play a song on the piano with only 5 fingers?
self_text: I’ve been trying to learn how to play piano, but I’m stuck because I can only play songs using my five fingers. My goal is to be able to play all of Beethoven's symphonies without assistance and it seems impossible if I cannot use my fingers correctly. What are some resources that could help me improve my technique so that I could eventually do this?

title: Why is it so difficult to talk on the phone?
self_text: My dad always says he has a really good voice, but when he talks on the phone he just sounds like a robot or something. When I call him, my voice always sounds weird too.  I was watching an episode of The Office and Michael Scott called his mom from work. Her voice sounded really bad and she said that she could not hear what he was saying. So I was thinking if they were having trouble hearing each other, why didn't they try talking slower? Or maybe there's some other reason for this?

title: How do I get over a breakup?
self_text: It's been two weeks and I still think about them every hour of the day. My friends have told me to move on, but it's so hard!  What is something that can help me forget someone who I had feelings for?

title: Is it normal to have a lot of trouble sleeping?
self_text: I've been having trouble falling asleep for about 2 weeks now, and when I do fall asleep, it’s usually not for very long.  I've tried a bunch of things like drinking warm milk, meditating, taking magnesium, trying to go to bed at the same time each night, etc., but nothing seems to be working. It’s also kind of worrying because my mom always said that she had insomnia as a child, so I’m wondering if there is some genetic predisposition to me too.  It makes me feel really tired during the day, which is causing me to have more anxiety.  Do you guys think I should see a doctor or something about this?

title: AITA for taking my daughter to the doctor after she told me she was being bullied?
self_text: I had a really bad day at work today, and I know how it feels to be picked on or made to feel small. I'm trying to help her feel better about the situation.  My daughter is in grade 6 and has been getting bullied by some girls in her class. She doesn't want to tell anyone, but she did say that they were calling her names and laughing when she walked down the hall. It's hard because she is so shy and quiet, and I don't want to make things worse. I am not sure what to do, so I have asked for advice.  I would like to talk with someone who can give me more insight on how to deal with this issue.

title: Is it a bad thing to be able to tell when someone is lying?
self_text: I know its kind of weird but like sometimes I can just look at someone and tell if they're lying, or if their words are not matching the truth. Like it's like a gut feeling or something?  Like how some people can smell poison before eating something or detect fire before seeing flames? It kinda feels the same way in my head?

title: why do we need to go to school?
self_text: I’ve been thinking a lot about why I have to go to school and I just can’t find a good reason as to why we should be forced to sit in a classroom all day for education when there are other ways of learning, like the internet or books. And then I found out that schools aren't actually meant for education, they are more like prisons. If you were to look at the history of schools it goes back to the time of slavery where people were made to learn how to work so they would be better slaves. A lot of the things taught in schools don’t help anyone, but only serve to make us obedient and docile. The way these systems are set up is designed to keep us controlled, which makes me think that what they teach us isn’t really important, its more important that we are trained to accept everything that comes our way without questioning it. It also keeps us from becoming thinkers or problem solvers because we’re always told what to think and what to do. This system is not here for our benefit. We’re not supposed to grow up and become independent people with critical minds, we’re supposed to turn into workers who follow orders without question. What about the fact that most of what we learn is useless? Like, I went through algebra last year, and I still don’t know how to use it in real life. How many times have you heard someone say “I never used algebra in my life”? Most of the stuff they try to cram into our heads is just fluff and nonsense. And even if some of it is useful, it doesn't really prepare us for the world outside of school.  School doesn’t teach us anything about life skills, such as cooking, cleaning, basic repairs, budgeting, or personal finance. All it teaches us is how to memorize information and regurgitate it on tests. This is insane! It’s a waste of time and energy. So basically, going to school is designed to keep us subservient.

title: Why did my friend get kicked out of a gym for wearing a bikini?
self_text: She said she was just trying to work out and that it wasn't really about the clothes, but I think there were some guys looking at her in the gym.

title: AITA for not wanting to help my dad?
self_text: My dad is a bit of an alcoholic and has been having issues with his work lately. He's been pretty down about it, but he hasn't really talked to me about it or anything. Yesterday I went over to his house because he was out on the porch drinking again, and when I got there he started yelling at me and telling me that I should have never left him so long ago. I told him how sorry I am and tried to comfort him, but he just kept going on and on. I was getting really uncomfortable and upset by his behavior, so I said to him that if he kept acting like that I would leave. Then he yelled at me even louder, and he said some really awful things. At that point, I felt like I had no choice but to leave as well. So I did, and I haven't spoken to him since. I know I shouldn't have done that, and I feel really bad about it, but I also feel like I couldn't handle any more of his yelling and anger. I'm worried about him though, and I don't want him to be alone.  I feel like I should have stayed longer and listened to him, but I think I made the right decision in the end. What do you guys think? AITA?

title: How does the word "asshole" come to be?
self_text: I was reading a book and it used the word “asshole” in context of someone being disgusting, but I don’t understand how it came to mean that thing, I just know it’s an insult.

title: AITA for leaving my friend in the middle of her wedding?
self_text: I’m so sorry, I don’t know what to do.  My best friend and I have been friends since high school. We’ve done everything together; we were on the cheer team together, we took the same classes together, etc. She got engaged last year, and I was SO excited for her. The wedding was planned to be held at a church near my house, which is why I agreed to drive her to the venue. Her mom insisted that she stay over at her place, as she had never spent a night away from home before.  I drove her to the venue and helped set up decorations. During the ceremony, I went to get a drink at the bar, but when I came back, I saw her crying. When I asked her if something was wrong, she said it was because she couldn't stop thinking about how much money she had to spend on the wedding, and how the rest of her family would not be there. As I was trying to comfort her, her fiancé (who has been working at the bar) walked out on us. My best friend then started yelling at me, telling me to leave and go, and that I shouldn’t be around her during such an important day. She kept saying how stupid I was for ruining her special day.  I ended up leaving, but after the wedding, I realized that my actions ruined her entire wedding. I sent her a text apologizing for ruining her wedding, and she replied with “You always ruin things.”  Is AITA?

title: Is it okay to order food online from a restaurant without leaving the house?
self_text: I have been ordering food from restaurants for months now and I think it's time that I go out and try something new. But there are certain times when I would really like to get some food but don't want to leave my home. What can I do?

title: AITA for not doing my little sister's homework?
self_text: My parents were on a long business trip and left me in charge of my younger sister, who is only 8 years old. She wanted me to do her homework with her, which I was happy to do since she would usually give me the answers as well. However, she kept trying to cheat and get me to write down the answers. I tried telling her that it wasn't fair but she wouldn't listen and continued to keep asking me to help her out. Eventually, I got frustrated and said that I won't do her homework anymore. When my parents returned home, they didn't say anything about what happened at school or how she behaved while I was taking care of her.  I feel like I did the right thing by refusing to do her homework, but I also don't want to hurt my sister's feelings.  AITA?

title: AITA for not wanting to go to a family gathering?
self_text: I live in the US, and my mom wants me to come to her house to celebrate Thanksgiving with my grandparents, aunts, uncles, and cousins on Thursday. She says that it's important to spend time together as a family, but she hasn't been to see me since I moved to college over a year ago. Her response was “I’ll have to do everything myself.” My grandma and grandpa are really old and their health is not great. I feel like they’re expecting me to be there for support and companionship, but I don’t know if I can commit to spending a whole day at their house when I’m busy with classes and work. I told her that I wasn’t sure if I could make it because of my schedule, and she said, “That’s too bad. You always say you’re busy.” She then said something else about how my life has changed and how I used to be more considerate of her feelings. She was being condescending, and I didn’t appreciate it. I just want to go to school to focus on getting through my studies without having to worry about anything.  I’ve told her many times that I miss her and want to see her, but she doesn’t seem to care about my feelings. It makes me feel like she isn’t happy with my current situation and feels that I am no longer a part of the family. I would love to visit her sometime, but right now I cannot prioritize going to her house due to my academic workload. She’s always making things difficult and making me feel guilty for needing time to focus on my goals.

title: Is there a specific way to put on a dress?
self_text: I am trying to put on my dress and it is getting caught in the zipper, so how do I put it on without hurting myself?

title: AITA for telling my mom she looks like an old woman?
self_text: My mom is the sweetest person I know and I love her to death, but lately she's been putting a lot of effort into her appearance (makeup, clothes etc.) and I can't help but think that it's pathetic. Like she's trying too hard and doesn't look good doing so. When I was younger I never thought much about it but recently, especially in the last few years, I've started seeing more and more similarities between her and older women (like grandma or something) - she has wrinkles, grey hair, and just generally looks like she's getting old.  I told her "you look like an old lady" during dinner when she was wearing a dress with a floral pattern and some makeup and she got really upset and cried. I felt terrible and apologized immediately but now I feel like I should have kept my thoughts to myself. She said I didn't have to say anything if I don't want to and that it's okay if I don't like how she looks. But I do! And I don't understand why she would put in all this effort to try and look young when she already has such a lovely personality. I also hate that she keeps buying all these things she doesn't need to make herself look pretty because she's getting old. I think she's getting sick of trying to look young and maybe she just wants to accept her age. I think she does realize that she's not looking good and that's why she's trying to hide it. What am I wrong for thinking this way? I should be able to say what I think without being attacked. Maybe she has a reason for wanting to look young but I don't know what it is.

title: AITA for telling my friend she has bad taste?
self_text: I’ve been friends with this girl since middle school and we’re both really into the same things (like Kpop, anime, etc.). We hang out all the time and always have fun together. She recently bought a new lipstick shade called “Tutti Frutti” from Maybelline. It looks like a bright pink color. It looked nice at first but then I noticed it was too much and didn't suit her complexion well. So, I told her that I think she should try something else.  I know I can be insensitive sometimes, but I just want to help her find makeup shades that are more suited for her. She got really upset and said that I shouldn’t give my opinion about her makeup. But honestly, I don’t see why she is so mad! Like, what if I don’t like her choice of lipstick?! Does that mean you need to go on a rampage? I feel sorry for her because she is already struggling in life with a lot of pressure, but I don’t understand why she is acting like this!  I told her I was wrong, and she would not let me off the hook. She started yelling at me saying I am being rude, insensitive, and judgmental. I was trying to be helpful, but she wouldn’t listen. I guess there were people around us when I said these things. How do I fix this situation without hurting her feelings?

title: is it possible to get a cold or flu in the summer?
self_text: I know that its supposed to be harder to get sick in the summer because of the heat but my friend said she got a bad cold last week and i was wondering if it's possible for me too?

title: why does the ad for a job call for a certain degree or experience?
self_text: if a company needs someone with a bachelor’s in engineering, what is their reasoning for posting a job that requires this, when they could just hire someone with more relevant work experience? I get it as a gatekeeping measure to prevent unqualified people from applying, but how does a company know who has actual skills and knowledge, versus just someone with a piece of paper?

title: AITA for putting my mom in the hospital?
self_text: I was at my friend's house and we were playing on the computer when her dad said something about me not being able to play the game because I didn't buy it. He said I could only play if I bought it, which is ridiculous since he owns the console. So I told him that I wasn't going to buy it and he got mad. Then he started yelling at me and saying stuff like "You're a horrible person" and "I can't believe you'd say that". My friend's mom heard everything and she asked what was wrong so I explained what had happened and she was super mad at my dad. She called my dad's boss who then called my dad's mom's mom (my grandma) who drove over to their house and yelled at my dad even more. After that, my dad took my mom to the hospital where they both stayed overnight. When my mom came home, she was super mad at me and said she wanted to kill me. It's been a week now but my mom still hasn't forgiven me. I feel really bad about what happened, but I don't know how to make things right. AITA?

title: why is the word "assault" so much more vulgar than just saying "hit"?
self_text: I don't understand why saying someone hit another person is not vulgar, but calling it an assault is. Like, yeah there are different levels of violence, but the difference in how we speak about them seems completely arbitrary. It’s like “punch” vs “strike”, but both are just hitting something.  Why do we use such a violent and unsettling word to describe something that could be described as simply hitting?

title: AITA for telling my sister she's a terrible person?
self_text: My sister is the WORST human being I have ever encountered. She has been doing horrible things to me, my mom and dad since we were all young, and she has never changed in her evil ways. We used to be close when we were younger but that was years ago. Now she won't even look at us, let alone talk to us. But here's where it gets worse, because every time I try to make conversation with her or just ask how she is, she acts like I am an idiot by rolling her eyes and saying "I'm fine" which clearly isn't true. The worst part is that she wants to take over the house after our parents die. I think she does this to get attention from our parents so they will treat her better, but this also hurts them, as they are trying to hold onto their home. So when she asks if she can move into the house after our parents die, I said no and explained why, and then she went on and on about how stupid I am and how I don't understand what she's going through. All I wanted was for her to stop making my life miserable.  So yeah, I told her she is a terrible person, and I regret nothing.

title: AITA for calling my friend out in front of everyone?
self_text: Okay so like, we were at the mall and I was with my friend, let's call her Jess.  She was wearing a crop top that was really short and showed a ton of skin. It wasn't even hot or anything (it was pretty cold) and it just looked uncomfortable. We talked about it when she left but now she is trying to make me feel bad because I told her she should cover up. She is so sensitive and always gets mad. Like, it's not my job to police what people wear. Why does she need to be upset that I said something?? But I think if I had done it privately I would have been less rude. Maybe. But I don’t want her to get mad. I was kind and respectful when I said it but she immediately went off on me and started insulting me and saying that I was being a bully. I don't know what to do.

title: AITA for telling my friend to stop wearing a bra?
self_text: My friend is getting hit on the street and it's driving me insane, so I told her to take off her bra when she goes out in public because it makes her look like a target.  I'm not proud of myself but it felt like the right thing to do. Now she's crying at me saying I was a mean person.  So now I'm questioning if I was an asshole or just a concerned friend.

title: AITA for asking my friends to stop talking about their new relationships?
self_text: I (17F) have been friends with a group of girls since middle school. We've been through so much together and are super close, but recently they've started obsessing over their new boyfriends. They spend almost all of our conversations talking about them or what they did, which is kinda annoying because we used to talk about everything else, like our lives and stuff. I tried to bring up other topics, but they just keep going back to the boyfriends. Yesterday, I asked if they could please stop talking about them when we hang out and that it would make me sad/uncomfortable that they only focus on these guys. When I said that I felt uncomfortable I was trying to say how much more comfortable I would be if they didn't talk about them at all. I think I went too far though, because now some of them are acting like I hate them and don't want to hang out anymore. I thought they were being unreasonable, but now I feel like maybe I was wrong?  I do remember when they were all dating other people and it was pretty awkward then too, and I can see why they might be obsessive, but I also need to be able to hang out with my friends without feeling like I’m being ignored. Is there any way to approach this situation without making them think I hate them? Am I the asshole here?

title: AITA for telling my wife she's a terrible cook?
self_text: My wife has been cooking for me for the past 2 years, and I've never complained or said anything negative about her food (even when it's not good). She just recently got pregnant with our first child, so I was expecting her to be more cautious in the kitchen. The day before yesterday, she made me something that looked like chicken pot pie. It tasted awful - salty, bitter, and dry. It reminded me of the time I had a bad flu, but worse. When I asked her why it was so bad, she told me she used only ingredients from the local market. Turns out, the salt she put into the pot was table salt which is almost 35% sodium chloride, not kosher salt, which has less sodium chloride and therefore tastes less salty. She also didn’t know that if you use too much rosemary, thyme, etc., the flavour will come across as bitter.  I immediately went on the defensive, saying that I knew a lot more about cooking than she did and how I would have done it differently. I don’t want to hurt her feelings, because I love her, but I think I should be allowed to express my opinion on how things can be improved.  She then cried and accused me of trying to make her feel insecure, implying that I thought I was better than her.  The next day, she tried to apologize by making me my favourite meal, spaghetti Bolognese. But the sauce was super watery, and the meat tasted raw. I ended up going back to eating store-bought meals. Is she an asshole for being upset with me after I pointed out all these mistakes? Or am I the asshole for bringing up such personal matters? AITA?

title: AITA for getting into a fight at my school?
self_text: So, I’m in a pretty competitive school and everyone is always trying to outdo each other. We had a huge project due last week and the group was not working together so I took it upon myself to help them. They were just being lazy and didn’t want to do anything so they left me to carry the whole thing. When the teacher asked about our progress, we told her that we were almost done but she didn’t seem to buy it. She said she would check up on us later. That night, I decided to go back and finish the work so when I got there, I found everyone was already finished! I went over to ask what they did to get done so fast and they started saying some stuff about how I was supposed to have done everything. Then I realized they lied to the teacher so I told them I was going to tell her. Then they started yelling at me and threatening to beat me up. I called the principal because he knew I worked hard and was doing everything by myself and I wanted him to make sure they wouldn’t bully me anymore. The principal told them they couldn’t do that or else he would call the police. He also told them I could leave if I wanted to. But then they kept harassing me even after I left and I got threatened again. So, I confronted them and told them they needed to stop bullying me. They started shouting at me and calling me names and things like that. I was trying to calm down and not escalate things further, but they kept pushing me until finally I snapped and punched one of them. The principal came and told me I was being a jerk for punching someone, but he also said they were being jerks for threatening me all day and I was justified in protecting myself.  I'm so upset and worried about what will happen next. Please tell me if I'm an asshole for punching someone who was constantly harassing me.

title: AITA for going to a party where my friend's boyfriend was doing some stuff with another girl?
self_text: I (17F) went to a party last night at my friend Lily's house, and she invited me.  I've known Lily since kindergarten, so we're pretty close. Her boyfriend, Jack, is also a good friend of mine, but he's always been a bit of a creep. Like, not in the way you think - he doesn't do anything physically violent or threatening, but he has this weird obsession with watching people and sometimes even trying to touch them without their permission. He's not a bad guy, just really awkward and socially inept. Last week, I noticed that he kept staring at some other girl at the party, who was about my age. She seemed kind of uncomfortable too, like she didn't want him to stare at her.  Lily and Jack were together all night, but I could see they weren't really into each other. They just kinda hung out. About an hour after I got there, I saw Jack and this other girl, Chloe, talking in a corner. Chloe looked around a lot, and I could tell she felt super uncomfortable.  I didn't hear what they were saying, but I did see Jack putting his hand on her shoulder. I started getting worried, so I went over to check on Chloe and ask her if she was okay. She said yes, but then she looked at me and gave me a really sad look. Then, Jack walked up to us and apologized to Chloe and told her that he wasn't paying attention and that he would stop it.  At first, I was mad at Jack for making Chloe feel uncomfortable, but then I realized that he probably just had a really hard time expressing himself. But I couldn't shake off the feeling that something was wrong, especially because Chloe looked really hurt. So I went to talk to Lily about it, and she asked me if I knew what was going on. I explained everything, and she got really upset and angry at Jack. She told me that she wanted to break up with him, which is something she's been considering for a while now. After I talked to Lily, I decided to leave the party. I didn't want to be part of whatever was happening. Later, I found out that Chloe had actually left the party because she was having a panic attack. I feel terrible about this whole situation. I don't know whether I should apologize to Lily, and I'm not sure how I should feel about Jack. Do I owe Chloe an apology? I feel awful, but I can't help but feel like I'm responsible for everything. I'm not proud of the fact that I helped make Chloe feel like that, but I didn't mean to cause any harm. Should I apologize to Lily? I'm unsure. What do I do?

title: AITA for telling a racist friend to leave my friends alone?
self_text: I'm not sure if I'm the asshole or not, so I thought I'd ask here.  I have a group of friends, like 5-6 people who are all pretty close and do everything together. One of them is named Alex. He’s really nice in person but he’s a big racist. He keeps making jokes about immigrants, and he talks about his “favorite” racial groups. I’ve tried talking to him about it before, but he just brushes me off and says that I'm too sensitive. It’s gotten to the point where I don’t even want to be around him when he’s trying to bring up these topics.  Yesterday we were at my house after school and we were playing video games. Alex was complaining about how he couldn't get into a game because he didn't know how to play. I offered to help him learn the game, and he refused. When I asked why he said something really stupid. He said "Why can't you be more like [insert racial group]?" I lost it. I told him that his comments are always offensive and that I don't care what he thinks. He started yelling at me and calling me names, and then he left. I felt bad about telling him that, especially since he was upset and I realized that maybe I went too far. I apologized to my other friends later on, and they seemed to understand. But now I'm starting to think that I might have been the asshole. I know racism is wrong, and I hate hearing those kinds of things from Alex. But I also feel like I should protect my friends from him.  I'm not proud of how I reacted yesterday, but I also don't want to let him continue saying these awful things. I feel like I’m being attacked by a bully, and my friends need to stand up to him as well. I haven’t done anything yet.

title: Why does the "who's crying" meme still exist?
self_text: I saw it on a tiktok that was just a bunch of people crying in the background and the text said "who's crying".  It has been around for like, years and everyone uses it now to describe something sad or upsetting. It's so annoying and overused at this point. It's literally just showing a bunch of people crying.
